meanings.definition: Incapable of being fully understood or explored.
meanings.sent1: The complexity of the math problem was unfathomable to the students.
meanings.sent2: The vastness of the ocean was unfathomable to the sailors.
meanings.sent3: It was unfathomable how the clown fit so many balloons in his tiny car.
meanings.sent4: Her unfathomable kindness touched the hearts of everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the night sky was unfathomable, filled with countless stars.

meanings.definition: Impossible to measure the depth of.
meanings.sent1: The darkness of the cave was unfathomable, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent2: The chasm was so deep that its bottom was unfathomable.
meanings.sent3: The amount of ice cream he ate was unfathomable, yet he still wanted more.
meanings.sent4: The unfathomable sorrow in her eyes spoke volumes without a word.
meanings.sent5: The unfathomable silence of the forest at night was both eerie and peaceful.
